children.text:
Implement a bubble sort for the diffs array. Subroutine to sort an integer array:

subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: n

   integer :: i, j, temp

   do i = 1, n-1

      do j = 1, n-i

         if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

            temp = arr(j)

            arr(j) = arr(j+1)

            arr(j+1) = temp

         end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine bubble_sort But in the code, the array is diffs, which is allocated with size n. So in the main program:

call bubble_sort(diffs, n)

Then proceed to count unique elements.

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, m, returnDex, i, j, count_unique, result1

   integer, allocatable :: diffs(:)

      result1 = count_unique

   ! Now process the second program's step

   character(len=20) :: str_result

   write(str_result, '(I0)') result1

   ! Replace commas with spaces

   do i = 1, len_trim(str_result) if (str_result(i:i) == ',') then

         str_result(i:i) = ' '

      end if

   end do

   print *, trim(str_result)

contains

   subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

      integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      integer :: i, j, temp do i = 1, n-1

         do j = 1, n - i

            if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

               temp = arr(j)

               arr(j) = arr(j+1)

               arr(j+1) = temp

            end if

         end do

      end do

   end subroutine bubble_sort

end program main

Hmm, perhaps the code is okay. Testing with a small example:

Suppose n=3, diffs = [5,3,4]

After first pass (i=1):

j runs from 1 to 2 (since n-i = 3-1=2). First j=1: compare 5 and 3 → swap → [3,5,4]

j=2: compare 5 and 4 → swap → [3,4,5]

After first pass, the array is [3,4,5]. Second pass (i=2):

Inner loop runs j from 1 to 1 (3-2=1). j=1: compare 3 and 4 → no swap. So the array remains [3,4,5]. Thus, sorted correctly. Another test case: [3,1,2]. First pass (i=1):

j runs 1 to 2. j=1: 3 vs 1 → swap → [1,3,2]

j=2: 3 vs 2 → swap → [1,2,3]

Second pass (i=2):

j runs 1 to 1. j=1: 1 vs 2 → no swap. Thus sorted. So the bubble sort code works. Now, the rest of the code.

Implement a bubble sort for the diffs array.

Subroutine to sort an integer array:

subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: n

   integer :: i, j, temp

   do i = 1, n-1

      do j = 1, n-i

         if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

            temp = arr(j)

            arr(j) = arr(j+1)

            arr(j+1) = temp

         end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine bubble_sort

But in the code, the array is diffs, which is allocated with size n. So in the main program:

Putting all together.

Now, the code outline:

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, m, returnDex, i, j, count_unique, result1

   integer, allocatable :: diffs(:)

   character(len=100), dimension(:), allocatable :: strings

   ! Read n and m

   read *, n, m

   allocate(strings(n))

   allocate(diffs(n))

   ! Read the strings

   do i = 1, n

      read *, strings(i)

   end do

   returnDex = 0

   ! Process each string

   do i = 1, n

      character(len=100) :: current_str = strings(i)

      integer :: dexG, dexS

      dexG = index(current_str, 'G')

      dexS = index(current_str, 'S')

      if (dexG > dexS) then

         returnDex = -1

      end if

      diffs(i) = dexS - dexG

   end do

   if (returnDex == -1) then

      result1 = -1

   else

      ! Sort diffs array

      call bubble_sort(diffs, n)

      count_unique = 1

      do i = 2, n

         if (diffs(i) /= diffs(i-1)) then

            count_unique = count_unique + 1

         end if

      end do

      result1 = count_unique

   end if

   ! Now process the second program's step

   character(len=20) :: str_result

   write(str_result, '(I0)') result1

   ! Replace commas with spaces

   do i = 1, len_trim(str_result)

      if (str_result(i:i) == ',') then

         str_result(i:i) = ' '

      end if

   end do

   print *, trim(str_result)

contains

   subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

      integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      integer :: i, j, temp

      do i = 1, n-1

         do j = 1, n - i

            if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

               temp = arr(j)

               arr(j) = arr(j+1)

               arr(j+1) = temp

            end if

         end do

      end do

   end subroutine bubble_sort

end program main
